item.title: How do you obfuscate your code so noone can edit it?
item.dc:creator: @_Nirvana † Nirvana †
item.description:
@_Nirvana wrote:

[quote=“imafatmess, post:4, topic:135182”]With an obfuscator… AGAIN google search comes up with some pretty sexy results for this too!!!

Hmmm… I typed in java obfuscator and guess what comes up?!? Java obfuscators!!! Theres even one link which compares java obfuscation to your aunt edna trying to break into your house!

Remember, google knows all![/quote]

Ive been googling…

Read full topic
item.source: How do you obfuscate your code so noone can edit it?

item.title: How do you obfuscate your code so noone can edit it?
item.dc:creator: @ripzone Triton
item.description:
@ripzone wrote:

You use an obfuscator of course!

You can download one or make a simple one yourself.

Basically the first step you might want to do is name obfuscation, replace all variables, fields, classes and functions names with random and meaningless ones.

Then if you really want to go hardcore, you can try flow obfuscation, replace all loop constructs with equivalent but hard to understand code.

There are also other techniques like string encryption you might want to check out.

Read full topic
